medical_history.chief_complaint: Vomiting in the absence of nausea or abdominal pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until the evening prior to admission when she began urinating more frequently. She started vomiting later that night with several episodes of emesis, the last episode occurring at 9 am on the day of admission. The vomiting episode was noted to be much more severe than her usual intermittent vomiting at meals.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Alzheimer's dementia, history of right hip fracture status post ORIF, refractory C. difficile (no episodes in one year), depression, osteoarthritis, history of wrist fracture, osteopenia, cataract surgery.
